intro: Razulia alpina, commonly known as the alpine razulia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with cool temperatures. Its leaves are narrow and finely divided, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink in color. Razulia alpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
